Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Family-Administered Delirium Assessment Post-Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This pre-specified sub-study of two multicenter randomized controlled trials

Participants.evidence: patients aged 60 or older undergoing major elective surgery

Intervention.evidence: Delirium was assessed using the CAM or CAM-ICU and structured chart review. Family members completed the FAM-CAM concurrently

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the agreement between researchers’ and family members’ postoperative delirium assessments

Method_Outcome.evidence: to assess the incidence of positive FAM-CAM after hospital discharge up to 30 days postoperatively

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 817 patients had 1349 concurrent assessments

Result_Outcome.evidence: Agreement beyond chance was 79.7% with a kappa of 0.33
